## Functions

### analyzeLoadFromClobberingLoad() {#a9534d3bff0727cc904e6bbc1064d2e2f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::VNCoercion::analyzeLoadFromClobberingLoad (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; LoadPtr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42; DepLI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
This function determines whether a value for the pointer LoadPtr can be extracted from the load at DepLI.

This function is called when we have a memdep query of a load that ends up being clobbered by another load.

On success, it returns the offset into DepLI that extraction would start. On failure, it returns -1.

See if the other load can feed into the second load.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp/#l00236">236</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp">VNCoercion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### analyzeLoadFromClobberingMemInst() {#ab7c3af18d8706c2d91fd7e2f88424336}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::VNCoercion::analyzeLoadFromClobberingMemInst (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; LoadPtr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memintrinsic">MemIntrinsic</a> &#42; DepMI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
This function determines whether a value for the pointer LoadPtr can be extracted from the memory intrinsic at DepMI.

On success, it returns the offset into DepMI that extraction would start. On failure, it returns -1.

### analyzeLoadFromClobberingStore() {#a54e6f143ee9c14b9498e4f43b97c2525}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::VNCoercion::analyzeLoadFromClobberingStore (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; LoadPtr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/storeinst">StoreInst</a> &#42; DepSI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
This function determines whether a value for the pointer LoadPtr can be extracted from the store at DepSI.

This function is called when we have a memdep query of a load that ends up being a clobbering store.

On success, it returns the offset into DepSI that extraction would start. On failure, it returns -1.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp/#l00215">215</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp">VNCoercion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### analyzeLoadFromClobberingWrite() {#a1cdc82521ee78a15e2ca179d740a5049}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static int llvm::VNCoercion::analyzeLoadFromClobberingWrite (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; LoadPtr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; WritePtr, uint64&#95;t WriteSizeInBits, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function is called when we have a memdep query of a load that ends up being a clobbering memory write (store, memset, memcpy, memmove).

This means that the write <em>may</em> provide bits used by the load but we can&#39;t be sure because the pointers don&#39;t must-alias.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> this case to see if there is anything more we can do before we give up. This returns -1 if we have to give up, or a byte number in the stored value of the piece that feeds the load.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp/#l00177">177</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp">VNCoercion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Return true if CoerceAvailableValueToLoadType would succeed if it was called.

Return true if coerceAvailableValueToLoadType will succeed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp/#l00017">17</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp">VNCoercion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### coerceAvailableValueToLoadType() {#a351251756a2dcf559089f626d9241131}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; llvm::VNCoercion::coerceAvailableValueToLoadType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; StoredVal, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadedTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase">IRBuilderBase</a> &amp; Helper, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
If we saw a store of a value to memory, and then a load from a must-aliased pointer of a different type, try to coerce the stored value to the loaded type.

If we saw a store of a value to memory, and then a load from a must-aliased pointer of a different type, try to coerce the stored value.

LoadedTy is the type of the load we want to replace. IRB is <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a> used to insert new instructions.

If we can&#39;t do it, return null.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp">VNCoercion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getMemInstValueForLoad() {#a6b72d403292d9dddd1ef1ce3e8bc394c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; llvm::VNCoercion::getMemInstValueForLoad (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memintrinsic">MemIntrinsic</a> &#42; SrcInst, unsigned Offset, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; InsertPt, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
If analyzeLoadFromClobberingMemInst returned an offset, this function can be used to actually perform the extraction of the bits from the memory intrinsic.

This function is called when we have a memdep query of a load that ends up being a clobbering mem intrinsic.

It inserts instructions to do so at InsertPt, and returns the extracted value.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp/#l00375">375</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/vncoercion-cpp">VNCoercion.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getValueForLoad() {#a0786ad18996fdeb6bb0e33c3bfa4ce82}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; llvm::VNCoercion::getValueForLoad (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; SrcVal, unsigned Offset, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LoadTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; InsertPt, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
If analyzeLoadFromClobberingStore/Load returned an offset, this function can be used to actually perform the extraction of the bits from the store.

It inserts instructions to do so at InsertPt, and returns the extracted value.
